column5: JACKSONVILLE, FL -- An unhappy Subway customer called 911 not once, but twice to complain to police that his sandwich was not made to his liking.  Reginald Peterson called the Jacksonville Sheriffs Office in hopes that police could have his sandwich made to his satisfaction.  A short time later, Peterson contacted JSO again to complain that police still had not shown up.  When police did arrive Peterson told the officer he had ordered two sandwiches, checked out, and then walked outside to find the subs did not have "everything" he ordered.  He told police he became "very upset" and "belligerent" because the employee making the sandwich was not doing it correctly.  Witnesses inside the store say Peterson eventually started screaming at everyone inside. When Peterson went outside to call police. Employees closed the store and locked the door to keep him from returning.  According to the report, the officer tried to calm Petterson and explain to him the proper way to use 911, but he would not cooperate.  Peterson was arrested and at his request the sandwiches were thrown away.
I heard about this the other day. It's hard to understand how stupid some people can be, isn't it?
ahahahaha ohhh man  some people are pure idiots  they were probably gross subs n e ways
this is why we have 911 call takers.....to weed out stupid morons like this......i've sat with them in our communications centre and you wouldn't believe some of the dumb things people call about....
lol my grandfather called 911 last summer from his cottage to see if the phone was working. LOL
Gotta feel sorry for the guy. He obviously had a very bad day.......They will probably check if he has a history, if not they will let him go.
LOL....the employees inside the Subway must of thank their lucky star when the guy went outside to call the cops LOL  Absolutely incredible Leechman
The word "IDIOT" keeps dancing through my mind.    Absolutely hillarious douG. I almost wet myself. I was laughing so hard, the kids came running to see what happened.
